sentence.Network_en: Her eyes dulled and she gazed blankly.
sentence.Network_cn: 她眼神暗淡，呆呆地凝视着。
她面无表情地凝视着他。

sentence.Network_en: She stared blankly at the brick wall in front of her.
sentence.Network_cn: 她面无表情地瞪着面前的砖墙.

entry.def: Something that is blank has nothing on it.

example.ex: We could put some of the pictures over on that blank wall over there...
example.tran: 我们可以把一些图画贴在那边的空白墙壁上。

example.ex: He tore a blank page from his notebook.
example.tran: 他从他的笔记本上撕下一页空白纸。

entry.def: A blank is a space which is left in a piece of writing or on a printed form for you to fill in particular information.

example.ex: Put a word in each blank to complete the sentence.
example.tran: 每个空格填上一个单词，把句子补充完整。

entry.tran: 茫然的；漠然的；毫无表情的
entry.def: If you look blank, your face shows no feeling, understanding, or interest.

example.ex: Abbot looked blank. 'I don't quite follow, sir.'...
example.tran: 阿博特一脸茫然。“我没听明白，先生。”

example.ex: His daughter gave him a blank look.
example.tran: 他女儿漠然地看了他一眼。

entry.def: If your mind or memory is a blank, you cannot think of anything or remember anything.

example.ex: I'm sorry, but my mind is a blank...
example.tran: 对不起，我脑子里一片空白。

example.ex: I came round in hospital and did not know where I was. Everything was a complete blank.
example.tran: 我在医院里醒了过来，不知道自己身在何处。一切都是空白。

entry.def: Blanks are gun cartridges which contain explosive but do not contain a bullet, so that they cause no harm when the gun is fired.

example.ex: ...a starter pistol which only fires blanks.
example.tran: 只发射空包弹的发令枪

entry.def: If you draw a blank when you are looking for someone or something, you do not succeed in finding them.

example.ex: They drew a blank in their search for the driver.
example.tran: 他们四处寻找那个司机，但一无所获。

entry.def: If your mind goes blank, you are suddenly unable to think of anything appropriate to say, for example in reply to a question.

example.tran: 我的脑子突然一片空白。

auth_sentence.content: At first he was blankly incredulous. It could not be Judson.
auth_sentence.res_content: At first he was blankly incredulous. It could not be Judson.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: At first he was blankly incredulous. It could not be Judson.

auth_sentence.content: His expression was uncomprehending and blankly exhausted.
auth_sentence.res_content: His expression was uncomprehending and blankly exhausted.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His expression was uncomprehending and blankly exhausted.

auth_sentence.content: Dakotah looked up at him blankly, his hands folded on the table.
auth_sentence.res_content: Dakotah looked up at him blankly, his hands folded on the table.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Dakotah looked up at him blankly, his hands folded on the table.

sentences.en: She stared blankly at the brick wall in front of her.
sentences.cn: 她面无表情地瞪着面前的砖墙。

sentences.en: He had just poked up the fire and was staring blankly at the flames when someone burst in.
sentences.cn: 他刚拨旺炉火,正茫然凝视着火焰,这时有个人闯了进来。
